meanings.definition: to form or mold into a particular shape before the final product is completed
meanings.sent1: She preshapes the clay before making a pot.
meanings.sent2: The sculptor preshapes the metal before crafting the statue.
meanings.sent3: The baker preshapes the dough into little balls before baking them.
meanings.sent4: His vision preshapes the future of the company.
meanings.sent5: The architect preshapes the design in her mind before drawing it out.

meanings.definition: the initial outline or structure of something before it is fully developed
meanings.sent1: The preshapes of the building were visible even in the early stages of construction.
meanings.sent2: The preshapes of the story hinted at an exciting plot to come.
meanings.sent3: The preshapes of the puzzle made it look easy, but it was actually quite challenging.
meanings.sent4: The preshapes of the garden gave a glimpse of its future beauty.
meanings.sent5: The preshapes of the dress on the mannequin inspired the fashion designer.
